page.title: 06 COMMUTING FROM MAIDSTONE
page.content: {Commuting}has become known as the curse of the South East. Many brave the daily struggle in and out of London using the{railways.} This area has two railway lines to Victoria Station and Charing Cross Station in London. The former is served by Maidstone East and Barming stations and the latter by the Barracks Station.Between 06.30 and 08.30 and again from 17.30 to 20.30 they see a steady stream of commuters. The majority using this service are male and between 17 and 45 years old. Most live within three miles of the station,travelling to it by various methods - car, moped, bus and cycle and often by foot. Commuting is becoming more popular in this area and its effects can be seen in the expansion of the housing areas. by Jane Todd and Cathy Lambert
